author: Reuters Editorial
title: 'I am innocent,' South Africa's Zuma tells cheering crowd
text:
DURBAN, South Africa (Reuters) - Former South African president Jacob Zuma told thousands of supporters outside court in Durban on Friday that his opponents were telling lies and he would be proven innocent in a corruption case against him.
Jacob Zuma, the former president of South Africa waves to his supporters on his way to the high court in Durban, South Africa, April 6, 2018. REUTERS/Mike Hutchings Speaking in Zulu in his home province, Zuma said that the judiciary and politicians believed that he did not have rights.
“The truth will come out. What have I done?” Zuma told the cheering crowd. “I am innocent until proven guilty.”
Reporting by Nqobile Dludla; Writing by Alexander Winning; Editing by Joe Brock
